title: I Finished Second in the Cheapskate Sweepstakes
sub_head: Tommy, Greg and I turned my 50th-birthday getaway into a competition to see who could be most frugal.
body:
I turned 50 in June, and planned a South Carolina beach getaway with my wife, Devin, and two other couples. It felt extravagant, but that’s only because I was raised by a father who’d shut down his kids’ vacation inquiries by dryly asking, “What are we, the Gettys?”
In his defense, my old man was from the generation who believed gainful employment, three squares a day and a roof over your head were vacation enough from the vicissitudes of life. To seek more was to tempt fate and, like Icarus, fly too high on borrowed wings.
